basic_info.name: Sarah Mahdi
basic_info.description: Hi there! I'm Sarah Mahdi — a Certified Scrum Product Owner (CSPO) and Scrum Master (CSM) with a unique background that blends healthcare, military service, and technology. I began my career as a linguist and cultural advisor in the U.S. military, then moved into the pharmaceutical industry, where I gained deep experience in regulated workflows, patient access, and cross-functional collaboration. My passion lies in building impactful digital products that improve people’s lives. I’ve led projects across software development, product ownership, and data analysis, and I’m currently pursuing a Master of Science in Cybersecurity Engineering. My work sits at the intersection of security, user experience, and value delivery. With a mission-driven mindset and a strong foundation in Agile product management, I specialize in translating complex challenges into practical, user-centered solutions. Whether it's launching an MVP, managing a backlog, or shaping secure systems, I thrive on creating products with purpose.

projects.title: Flashcard Simulation – Iraqi Arabic for Kids
projects.description: A work-in-progress flashcard simulation aimed at teaching Iraqi Arabic greetings to young learners through engaging cartoon characters. I defined the MVP, built a user-centered prototype, and developed both printable and digital-ready assets. This project demonstrates my product ownership skills across educational design, iterative development, and cross-cultural UX strategy.

projects.title: New Year Resolutions – Data Analysis
projects.description: This project involved analyzing a dataset of New Year resolutions using Python, pandas, and visualization libraries. I applied data cleaning, feature engineering, and exploratory analysis to reveal trends in user goals and categories. The project followed an Agile workflow for iterative insights and presentation.

projects.title: Park Finder – API & Frontend
projects.description: Built a full-stack park locator tool. I led requirement gathering and documentation, created an API roadmap, and collaborated on both backend and React frontend development. We used Trello for backlog grooming and Mural for wireframes.

projects.title: MilkshakesRUs
projects.description: A team project that lets users build custom milkshakes through a short quiz. The result displays a recommended shake, along with its calorie count and price. I contributed to the form logic and modal-based UI.

projects.title: Salmon Cookies
projects.description: A browser-based cookie sales simulator that generates dynamic hourly sales tables for different locations. I handled form inputs, object modeling, and DOM manipulation to update store data in real-time.

projects.title: Gallery of Horns
projects.description: A React application that renders a catalog of horned animals from JSON data. Features include filtering, modals, and props-based rendering. I worked on state management and UI responsiveness.
